Standalone Server Help

How do I execute an evaluation?

Using your preferred tool for network data transfers, such as Client for URL (CURL):

First close any existing evaluation to prepare the server

curl -X POST localhost:[PORT]/evaluation/close

Then you can execute the following call to start an evaluation and get the ID returned to you

curl -X POST -d "$(cat [DECLARATION_FILE])" localhost:[PORT]/evaluation/startEvaluation

How do I obtain a list of the outputs generated?

Take the ID generated from the startEvaluation call and make the following get call

This will return a list of paths for the output when the evaluation finishes

curl -X GET localhost:[PORT]/evaluation/getEvaluation/[PROJECT_ID]

How do I obtain the stdOut logs of the evaluation?

Take the ID generated from the startEvaluation call and make the following get call

This will return all the logs if the evaluation is finished or a real-time stream for ongoing evaluations

curl -X GET localhost:[PORT]/evaluation/stdOut/[PROJECT_ID]

How do I obtain an output file?

You can visit the paths produced by the getEvaluation call or you can get an individual file with the following call

curl -o [FILE_NAME] -X GET localhost:[PORT]/evaluation/[PROJECT_ID]/[FILE_NAME]
